intro: Aizoon sessiliflorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters. Aizoon sessiliflorum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
